comments:
Build 20020411

I have not been able to recreate this error but when I added a new runtime in
the PDE editor for the org.eclipse.jdt.ui plugin.xml I got the following
exception

java.lang.ClassCastException:
org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.views.ConfigurationView
	at
org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.manager.MainForm$1.linkActivated(MainForm.java:82)
	at
org.eclipse.update.ui.forms.internal.engine.FormEngine.activateLink(FormEngine.java:222)
	at
org.eclipse.update.ui.forms.internal.engine.FormEngine.handleMouseClick(FormEngine.java:136)
	at
org.eclipse.update.ui.forms.internal.engine.FormEngine.access$3(FormEngine.java:123)
	at
org.eclipse.update.ui.forms.internal.engine.FormEngine$6.mouseUp(FormEngine.java:99)
	at
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java(Compiled
Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java(Compiled
Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java(Compiled
Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:819)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:777)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:190)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:549)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:390)

This is really funny - how did you manage to pass mouse click event to a 
Preview View from Update perspective from within PDE manifest editor? I mean, 
we should fix a bug, but this looks like something from the Twighlight Zone :-).

Linux event handling is from the Twilight Zone at times <grin>... basically 
those inline editors can catch you all of the time as they don't clear as often 
as the Windows ones...

Tod, have you seen this error lately? It is fairly old and we would like to 
clean up defects that do not occur any more.
I don't do this very often but no I have not seen it since I logged it.

Never ran into the problem.
Re-open if you run across it again.
